availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Addison Thompson (Mercer County, Kentucky, gentleman)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, gentleman. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Amanda Singleton Thompson in Mercer County, Kentucky, in April 1835. Physician in Mercer County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Mercer County in 1850. Gentleman in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 365A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg District 2, p. 907.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 717.
"Joseph A. Thompson (1805-1881)," Find A Grave, Memorial #98339189, accessed April 12, 2018, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/98339189.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, 1824-1883, Film #000191854.
